text: This game is better than Xenoblade X in my opinion. While I did like the implementation of the mechs and the augments better in X, everything from the music to especially the story was better in Xenoblade if you ask me.

text: God yeah, X was missing so much of the wonderful world building and interesting characters/plot... such a let down ;;
author: Gilliganpants

text:
I would probably say that XC is better than XCX, though the scale of the world as well as gameplay in XCX is much more impressive than that in XC. 

If XC age well (which I believe it will) I will consider it a masterpiece, while I think of XCX as a really good game.

text: Don't mix coincidence with fate. No, but similar things have happened several times for me. For example some years ago I beat Golden Sun for the first time, and the next time I go on to youtube SupraDarky has uploaded a track from that game. #Scary

text: That happens to me literally every time I play a game, Supradarky always seems to upload a track from that game as or after I'm going through it (or even while I'm still considering playing it, and the song is what makes me finally decide to).

author: DScribbleF

text: SUPRADARKY I LOVE YOU
author: LuizAbruz

text: Late upload! I'm in the process of moving in my first (bought) home, so I've been through some very busy months. But it's all worth it as I now have the keys... the fun part begins! Back to Xenoblade, with all the great announcements during Nintendo's Switch presentation, X2 really caught me by surprise in a great way! It did look a bit rough around the edges in terms of framerate (which I know will be fixed) and I'm still not sure about the new, more JRPG cliché character design, but Monolith has to be one of my favorite developers ever so I'm confident it will be absolutely epic. The best news of all is that the Xenoblade Chronicles composing team is back, more ACE+ please!
author: SupraDarky

text: How do you take time out of your life to play so many games? You seem to have a pretty busy agenda in general
author: LuizAbruz

text: Gaming is one of my main hobbies and I make sure to reserve some of my time for it. While some people might see that as being a waste of time when surrounded by other responsibilities, I believe it actually helps me be more efficient with my other daily tasks as it helps me relax and refocus myself. My advice is to never give up on your hobbies and passions, as cheesy as that might sound.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky I hope you make 2016 an absolute joke. and release it on April 1st
author: Gabriel Morrissey is a butt

text: Seeing the list of returning composers was the most exciting part of the Xenoblade Chronicles 2 announcement for me! I also can't wait to hear what ACE+ brings this time around!
author: Cakeman777

text: I share your thoughts on the character design, I just like more "realistic" art designs in JRPGs.
author: Fak Yuh Googel

text: I prefer the more realistic style, but I also see why they're giving the JRPG look a shot. As well designed as Xenoblade characters usually are, their in-game models aren't exactly pretty up close. I could see this as their attempt to clean up the art style in general while keeping the sweeping sense of scale and adventure.
author: Michael Cockrum

text: You have a pretty big typo there, "I'm confident it will be anything but epic"
